resources.string: Reekwater is not a territory for the unprepared, traveler. I suggest you be extremely careful if you venture outside the settlement.
The marshes of this land are like no other in all Aeternum In the Old World, it was life that made nature so spectactular. Here, it is death
This settlement is facing hard times. Traveler. You are welcome here, but I cannot vouch for your safety.
Tread carefully in the swamps of Reekwater, wayfarer. Nature is beautiful, but it is also quite treacherous.
If you see any artifacts in these ruins, hands off! I've already claimed anything in this place in the name of research. I'm not leaving, either.
Shhh! Don't let them know I'm here. Please, please… anything but that.
Just in case you were wondering - all the drinks I serve are clean.
I run all the water I use through six layers of cloth, then triple distill it. Purest water you ever drank.
Here is what I wish to know - why do they call this place Reekwater? It's not like there is a bad odor… or is it just me?
I haven't the patience to entertain commoners. Begone.
Good health to you, Marauder. What is your request?
Good health to you, Marauder. What is your request?\n[ Level 56 required for Reekwater faction missions ]
Spare us both and move on, genius.
Save your good words. I need them not.
You were helplessly drawn to me, no? You think it is my charisma?
It is your pleasure to conversate with me, yes? How might I satisfy your wants, my friend?
It is your pleasure to conversate with me, yes? How might I satisfy your wants, my friend?\n[ Level 56 required for Reekwater faction missions ]
After all... Your primitive mind is fascinated by me, right, Marauder? How could it not be so?
Do you find a crisis of faith in my eyes, devotee? Perhaps the doubt is now creeping in?
Ah, {playerName}! I'm afraid I have some very bad news for you.
It would seem that Alchemist Krockes became a victim of his own ambitions - he has become Lost.
Ah, {playerName}! I'm afraid I have some very bad news for you.
It would seem that Alchemist Krockes became a victim of his own ambitions - he has become Lost.\n[ Level 56 required for Reekwater faction missions ]
Now we must move on to more imporant questions. How was it that Krockes was able to absorb those soul traces? Did he become Lost on purpose?
Now we must move on to more imporant questions.
How was it that Krockes was able to absorb those soul traces? Did he become Lost on purpose?\n[ Level 56 required for Reekwater faction missions ]
May the Spark carry you.
May the Spark carry you.
May the Spark carry you.\n[ Level 56 required for Reekwater faction missions ]
Do not be so bold, warrior.
You seek knowledge. I have advice. Forget your experiments and leave Reekwater while you can.
Secrets of the Swamp
It always gives me some comfort to see another warrior sent out to this gods-forsaken swamp.
Never thought I'd miss the deserts of Brimstone Sands, but I certainly do.
"Why did you come here?"
A question I ask myself every day, but of course, the answer is that it's my duty, as a citizen of New Corsica and of Aeternum.
I believe there are secrets stirring in the primordial waters of this land.
"What kind of secrets?"
Well, it's no secret that there's power here - power beyond human imagination.
The Ancients certainly knew how to harness it - but for what purpose? Don't you want to know?
"It's a mystery worth exploring."
Then perhaps you'd assist me? An opportunity's arisen but my antiquarian has vanished.
Ancient Tablets from the overgrown ruins nearby, and charcoal rubbings from Ancient Plaques. If you collect these, I'll reward you.
I've only just learned of these tablets, but I have high hopes. Bring back the tablets and charcoal rubbings and I'll share whatever I can translate.
Aha! Did I mention I'm a scholar of the Ancients' language? I've spent centuries studying - let's see what we can decipher here...
Hm. Yes, as elsewhere, it's clear they forced humans into servitude - the Guardians.
"Why did they need the Guardians?"
That is the question, isn't it? And the answer varies. In Brimstone Sands, the Guardians served entirely defensive purposes.
But here, it seems the Ancients were using some kind of... technology.
Collect Ancient Stone Tablets and Rubbings from any Ancient Plaques within Sunken Aspect, and return them to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and seek out the writings of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Take Rubbing from Ancient Plaque
Hope Springs Eternal
Yes, this is exactly what I was hoping to find. Don't you see? The Ancients forced their human subjects here to work on some type of… machinery.
"We should investigate further."
I absolutely agree. There's only one additional clue I can decipher from the writings you procured.
It seems the humans made some sort of pilgrimage to a primordial spring in the northwest mountains.
"I'll go check it out."
Excellent. With Abbington at large, I'm quite stuck here and can't visit the spring myself.
There's a symbol suggesting the waters there might have some healing power - I look forward to hearing what you discover.
Healing waters in the mountains… why would the Ancients sends their servants there?
Aha, you've returned! Unlike Abbington... at any rate, let's see what you found.
Hm. It appears the site was dedicated to a ritual of creation, involving... yes, some kind of devices.
Investigate the Ancient ruins of Skyview Repose, and return to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Investigate {POITags} for any clues about the Ancient Guardians
Search for any notes or clues about the Ancient Guardians
Collect the {itemName} from {targetName}
Investigate the top of the Skyview Repose tower
Paths Unseen
Damn it, but I wish Abbington was here! Who knows? The old fool may have become Lost or Corrupted.
Without him, I'm afraid I have to continue to entrust you with this work.
"Just tell me what's next."
Well, the map you recovered seems to locate the source of the devices used in the rituals.
It appears to be an underground facility hidden in the caves the locals call Rackham's Hollow. That, is where we search next.
Be wary in the caves. I've heard the Lost have domain there. But if it gives us clues about the Ancients' technologies, it's worth any risk.
Thank the gods you've returned! I was beginning to worry! And what are these...?
Oh... the Guardian Hearts we've seen in other places? This suggests the ritual at the spring was... perhaps where these were... Implanted?
"That's disturbing."
I knew some Guardians were human and others were constructed, but this suggests… some were both, in fact.
Even more thought-provoking - these hearts are incomplete, lifeless.
Colllect any remnants of the Ancients you can find in Rackham's Hollow. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Seek out any remnants of the Ancients in {POITags}
Seek out any remnants of the Ancients
(Optional) Search the rubble for any evidence of the Ancients
Defend against the Marooned Pirates
Search the Marooned officer for any evidence of the Ancients
Anatomy of the Heart
One thing Is certain - the Ancients were not benevolent rulers. However horrific it is, the mystery of what powered the Hearts remains.
"Where can we learn more?"

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: The ruins of Sha Makogai - they appear to have been the seat of the Ancients' power in this region.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: If you're willing, and very careful… any artifacts remaining there may tell us more. Mars protect you, my friend.
The ruins of Sha Makogai have been explored before, but perhaps something remains there of interest.
You have proven quite capable, my friend, and helpful too. Let me see what you've recovered.
Indeed, a functioning Guardian Heart... and opened? What's this inside? An Azoth crystal, and... vines? From a Dryad, no less.
"The source of the Hearts' energy."
That is... not what I expected. The Ancients combined their Azoth technology with the living essence of the Dryads... madness.
These tablets suggest the Dryad essence came from a… 'timeless pool'. Interesting.
Search for any remaining Ancient artifacts within the ruins of Sha Makogai. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and locate any remaining Ancient artifacts
Collect Tablets from {POITags}
Search for clues about the creation of the Ancient Guardians
Seek and Hide
I have to tell you, though, the source of the Dryads' essence is not the real mystery here.
It's this Azoth crystal - it is not natural, but rather… crafted somehow.
"What does that mean?"

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: It means we need to find Abbington - he knows more than I do about this business.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: He was last out at the ruins of Syleio Seko - please, you must go find him… or his notes, if that's all that remains.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Abbingdon" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: Please, make haste. If Abbington has not returned by now, it could be bad. We need him, or his work, at least.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Legatus" = Legatus Fulvius)
string.speaker: Antiquarian Abbingdon
string.name: AntiquarianAbbingdon

resources.string: Stellar timing! I knew Fulvius would eventually send someone. But I couldn't leave behind this artifact I've discovered… of course, I can't seem to collect it, either.
Uncover the whereabouts of Antiquarian Abbingdon, last sent to Syleio Seko.
Search {POITags} for any evidence of Abbingdon's whereabouts
Enter the ruins and search for Antiquarian Abbingdon
Secrets Best Left Unshared
This artifact, it's… well, it's a power no being should wield. And no matter what, we can't let it fall into Fulvius's hands!
"Why not?"
Because THIS is what he's after - an artifact the Ancients used to extract souls and turn them into Azoth!
Power beyond comprehension! I need to get it out of here… it belongs in a museum!
"Alright. I'll help you."
Good, because these Guardians are determined to stop me.
There's an Ancient device below - if you'll activate it and distract the Guardians, I'll pry the artifact loose and take it somewhere the Legion will never find it.
"What about Fulvius?"
You… you'll have to throw him off my trail. Tell him I became Lost!
But first, distract the Guardians so I can finally extract the artifact. I promise I will hide this damn thing. Then, who knows? Perhaps we'll meet again!
Bah! I didn't have enough time to work it loose! Please, let's try this again. We have no choice. It must be done.
Distract the Starvault Guardians downstairs, and I'll pry the relic loose. We can do this - we have to.

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: What news, my friend? I feel we are close to finding the secrets of the Ancients here. Tell me, did you find Abbington? What happened to the old fool?
"He's one of the Lost now."

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: Blast it! I needed that bastard, and his research! Bah, I've had it with this place!

string.comment: male referring to male ("Antiquarian" = Antiquarian Abbingdon)
string.speaker: Legatus Fulvius
string.name: LegatusFulvius

resources.string: Sorry, I do appreciate your help. But next chance I get, I'm going back to Brimstone Sands!
I cannot express what a difference you made. Without you, this entire effort would've been wasted.
Now I will return to New Corsica with pride... and years of research ahead of me.
Thank you for what you did out in those ruins. I promise you - I'm putting that relic somewhere the Legion will never find it.
Distract the Starvault Guardians while Antiquarian Abbingdon frees the Ancient artifact.
(Optional) Activate the Device in the lowest level of Syleio Seko
Provide a distraction for Antiquarian Abbingdon
An Expanding Threat
What have we here? Someone finally comes to help us? The Legion came, but they do nothing.
I have sounded the alarm in Reekwater for months, but no one understands the danger.
"What danger are you referring to?"
The Lost, the empty vessels… the Siren Queen. I told them, but others here are only concerned with the Angry Earth.
Now it's Corruption everyone fears, but soon, the Siren Queen will come for us all.
"Who's the Siren Queen?"
She leads the Lost Pirates here, but she is not content with that, believe me.
I was Headman of my village and watched it fall, and since then, I have watched her rise.
"Why is she so dangerous?"
Most Lost, they lack purpose; but the Siren, she has much purpose, dark purpose.
See for yourself - go to Maria's Rest - see how the Pirates' numbers grow. Destroy those you can, and you will see. Yes, you will see.
Go on now, go to Maria's Rest and see for yourself. Defeat as many pirates as you can, but it will not be enough.
[BLANK]
Investigate the Lost Pirates at Maria's Rest. Then report to Headmen Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and investigate the activities of the Pirates
Collect clues about the Pirates activities
Seek out any remaining journal pages from the questioning Pirate
Defiance and Doubt

string.comment: Fallthru default for Defiance and Doubt
string.speaker: Headman Onizuka
string.name: HeadmanOnizuka

resources.string: Now you can see. They spread like a plague, cobbling together flotsam into landlocked monstrosities. But you have found something more?

string.comment: Fallthru default for Defiance and Doubt
string.speaker: Headman Onizuka
string.name: HeadmanOnizuka

resources.string: These notes… they were all penned by the same hand, one that has experienced the cruelty of the Siren Queen firsthand. You must find her. We must know what she knows!
"Where should I start searching?"
This final note mentions a town to the northwest. From Maria's Rest, that would be Shipflight Comb. I would start there.
Be careful… the spirits of that place rest uneasy, and may not take kindly to your intrusion.
Shipflight Comb was once a bustling town, full of energy and life. What changed there, no one knows. No one, except the spirits that remain.
Don't kill me, please! Mercy! I'm not… not with them. Not anymore! Not for a long time really…
I didn't know! She was once not so bad, a good leader, brave, inspiring even…
"Who are you talking about?"
The... the Siren Queen, as she's known now. When we first came though, she promised a free society, all of us equals.
But then she changed... became that... serpent, started turning everyone Lost.
Track down the Pirate deserter, possibly hiding out in Shipflight Comb in Reekwater.
Seek out the Pirate deserter in {POITags}
Search for the Pirate deserter's hideout in {POITags}
A Hunger for Freedom
I mean, what was I to do? I didn't want to let her suck out my soul. So I've been hiding here… like for a REALLY long time. Safer here than anywhere out there.
"Why are you safer here?"
Oh, because she's gonna take the whole island. I mean, she's... wait - you're working me!
Look, I'll tell you things, but only if you get me food and water first. I've starved to death many times hiding here. It hurts!
I'll tell you what the Siren Queen's all about, but you gotta get me some grub first. Berries, hardtack, an old shoe - I'll eat anything at this point.
Oh, sweet mother ocean... praise you! This'll keep me fed for... I don't know how long.
Alright then, I guess one good turn deserves another and all that bilge... I'll tell you about the Siren Queen.
Find, craft, or purchase Meager Meals and Fresh Water for Katring Sanders in Reekwater.
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Queen's Gambit
The thing you gotta get is that the Siren Queen may have lost her soul, but she's gained something else.
I don't know what exactly, I mean this island's got all kinds of magics, and she's been scooping them up.
"For what purpose?"
Harnessing the island's magic, I figure. She's made these strange... 'banners' outta flotsam and relics.
It's like they suck the life out of you and give it to her. Ever since she put 'em up, she gets stronger.
"They should be destroyed."
You got a death wish, friend? You want to tear down the Siren Queen's banners, be my guest.
Just don't say I didn't warn you. You tear those down, my old crew will be hoppin' mad.
Good luck tearing down those banners. I mean it may be the only hope, but don't ask me to do it.
Well now, look who's played the odds and lived to tell! You're pretty mean scallywag, aren't you? Not as mean as the Queen, mind you, but you got salt.
"I destroyed the banners."
And she's already putting up more, I bet. I was thinking back to when this started...
It was after some of the crew brought back this weird magic-machine-thing from the ruins down the coast.
Destroy the mysterious Cursed Banners throughout Reekwater, then return to Katring Sanders.
Destroy Cursed Banners wherever Pirates may be found
Shivering Timbers
After that, she holed up in her cabin with the thing, and started inviting crew members in one-by-one.
When they came out, they were Lost… mindlessly doing her bidding.
"What happened then?"
That's when I hid, but they started getting salvage for those banners from all the wrecks on the shoreline.
If you really want to gum up her plan, you should strike those salvage operations. Don't come back here, though.
"Why not?"
Because you're drawing attention to my hiding spot! But thanks for the grub - it'll keep me from starving for a while, I reckon.
Oh, and good luck against the Siren Queen! You'll need it!
I think I'll be staying here. Like I said, it's safer. I mean you got salt, but if I was a betting woman - and I am - I'd bet on the Siren Queen. No offense!
At long last, you return! I was beginning to think you might've joined the Siren Queen's crew!
Now you have seen it with your own eyes, haven't you? She's as much a threat as this Corruption, I tell you.
Come on now. We had a moment there, but it's not like we're friends. This is my hiding spot - you go find your own.
Put a stop to the salvage operations at Scavenger's Shore and Bleachwood Coast, and report back to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and stall the Pirates' salvage operations
Collect {itemName} from a container in {POITags}
(Optional) Place Primed Powderkeg at the designated spot, then stand back
Defend against the Pirate salvage crew's assault
Words of Power
I know that her ambitions know no bounds, but I do not know what she truly seeks to achieve.
Is it dominion over all Aeternum? How would that be satisfying to one of the Lost?
"Maybe she's after something else."
Yes, and we must find out what that is. You have learned of this Ancient 'machine' she took from the ruins, yes?
That antiquarian - Abbington - he said her crew has been scavenging more such relics as well.
"We should find out why."
And so you must go, across the bay to the Ancient Lighthouse. Somewhere there, we will find evidence of what the Siren Queen's ultimately seeks to accomplish.
We must know what the Siren Queen ultimately seeks to accomplish before we attempt to confront her.

string.comment: male referring to female (Siren Queen), male referring to male (Johansson)
string.speaker: Headman Onizuka
string.name: HeadmanOnizuka

resources.string: Bless the winds that brought you back. Let me see, what clues did you find at the Lighthouse?

string.comment: male referring to female (Siren Queen), male referring to male (Johansson)
string.speaker: Headman Onizuka
string.name: HeadmanOnizuka

resources.string: Hm. These notes suggest her 'machine' has the power to steal souls from the living and channel them into another vessel…
Search Syleio Seko for clues about the Siren Queen's plans. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Investigate {POITags} for clues about the Siren Queen's plans
Collect notes relating to the Ancient 'machine'
A Plan's Deconstruction
Now, it all makes sense - her crew, my village, any other power she can draw - the Siren Queen wants to regain her soul.
And it would seem to empower her even further in the process.
"Is that even possible?"
Before now, I would not have thought so, but it does confirm my suspicions. The Siren Queen has the potential to become an even greater threat than the Corruption.
"Not if we stop her first."
I only hope we're not too late. This is why her crew was bringing those relics into my old village - Mistywater Thorp.
You must go there and recover or destroy these devices - whatever they are - to stop her from gaining more power.
I believe the Siren Queen's crew is using the relics to create more of these banners they put up across the territory. You must put a stop to this.
You have done well. There are already reports that there are fewer of those cursed banners.
Let us hope that this will arrest or at least very much slow down the Siren Queen's efforts. This settlement may well be spared.
"Let's hope so."
Indeed, at some time, I suspect we will have to confront the Siren Queen herself.
But for now, you have done a tremendous service for all of Reekwater. Take this as a token of our thanks.
Destroy the twisted Ancient relics in Mistywater Thorp. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Search {POITags} and destroy any Ancient relics found
Seek and destroy the twisted Ancient Relics stored in Mistywater Thorp
The Queen is Dead (Elite)
Your efforts have been noticed by the Siren Queen, and she has deployed her trusted lieutenants to the front in an attempt to stall any attack.
The time for a direct confrontation is upon us, whether we wish it or not.
"Let's not keep her waiting."
Ha! Well said! Now, the Siren Queen’s lieutenants have spread throughout that hodgepodge 'fortress' to the south.
One of whom holds the key to her sanctum... but we've been unable to discover which one.
"So I’ll need to find them all."
Yes, to cause the greatest impact – and to succeed, you’ll need allies by your side.
Without her lieutenants enforcing her orders, her grip may loosen for a time. But that's not the only goal to keep in mind.
"The machine?"
Exactly. You'll need to find a way to deal with that infernal machine the Siren Queen has cobbled together. A few well-placed casks of gunpowder should do nicely.
Then, you'll have to confront the Siren Queen herself.
After you light off that gunpowder, the Siren Queen won’t be pleased at all. You and your allies will need to be ready for the fierce battle ahead of you.
I’ve heard the Siren Queen has control over storms. Be careful.
We saw the plume of smoke from here, and heard the lightning strikes of the Siren Queen's fury! Since you made it back... can I assume she has been dealt with?
"For the moment, yes."
Even if she may return and reclaim her fortress, you removed the greater threat of her machine – something the island can’t restore!
You've given us a respite from the threat, and that’s worthy of praise, {playerName}!
"What now?"
I've spoken with Nelda at the bar - she'll keep her ears open for word of the Siren Queen's return and let you know if and when it happens.
But for now, please take these as thanks and a reward for all of your assistance.
Hunt down the Siren Queen's lieutenants, destroy the Ancient Machine, and defeat the Siren Queen. Then report to Headman Onizuka in the Reekwater Settlement.
Venture into {POITags} and put a stop to the Siren Queen's plans
Eliminate the {targetName}s in {POITags}
Search containers for {itemName}s
Destroy the Ancient Machine
Loot the {itemName} from one of the Siren Queen's lieutenants
Defeat the Siren Queen
Long Live the Queen (Elite)
Hunt down the Siren Queen's lieutenants, acquire a key, and defeat the Siren Queen.
Oi! Over here! Headman told me to keep an eye out for you, let you know if that Siren tart showed her scaly bum again.
Looks like she and those barnacles she calls her 'crew' are back and trying to start trouble again.
"Didn't take them long at all."
Sadly, no. Elsewhere on Aeternum, could take a week to come back... around here, it's always faster. Must be something in the water.
Anyway. Are you and your friends ready to tangle with her again?
"Of course."
Glad to hear it! Now, that machine may be destroyed, but her crew still holds the keys to the kingdom.
You'll need to hunt down the key again, then deal with the Siren Queen. You already know the way up. Good hunting!
Go on, off with you. You’ve things to do, I’ve things to do, and standing around won’t make any of them happen faster.
My old village cannot be avenged until the Siren Queen herself is defeated, for good.
I also fear that every moment she may be finding other ways to increase her power.
Travel to {POITags}
(Optional) Acquire a {itemName}
Defeat the Siren Queen
Go on, off with you. You’ve things to do, I’ve things to do, and standing around won’t make any of them happen faster.
On Floral Fauna
Greetings and welcome to Reekwater, traveler. I hope you have not brought trouble with you. We have trouble enough here already.
"What sort of trouble?"
These lands are sacred to nature, and any affront to nature on Aeternum will cause a reaction here.
The relentless spread of Corruption has imbued the Dryads with unnatural strength, strength that threatens the balance.
"Is there something we can do?"
I am unsure. I have studied the lifeforms of Reekwater for many years, collecting observations.
But I lost my journals in Glimmerfen recently when the Dryads became hostile. Would you mind reclaiming them?
My journals contain decades of insights regarding Reekwater and the Angry Earth. They must be reclaimed or all my work will have been in vain.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Oh praise the Earth mother you've returned! These journals are everything to me.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: I hope my work might help us placate the Angry Earth in this turmoil and someday bring us back into harmony with one another.
"Is such harmony possible?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: I believe it is… no, I know it is. Marsh Walker Afolabi will tell you otherwise, but she is stuck in the old ways of thinking.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Let me study my journals, then I hope you'll return so we can discuss this further.
Retrieve the Dryad journals dropped by Herbalist Langlais in the Glimmerfen. Then return it to her in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and search for the missing journals
Collect Journal: "Underestimated Intelligence"
Collect Journal: "The Promenade"
Collect Journal: "Vindicta Aeternum"
Pruning and Irrigation
Greetings, young one. I have seen you speaking with Herbalist Langlais. I believe you helped her retrieve her journals, yes? A kindness, indeed.
"Why didn't you help her?"

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Because she has much to learn, and her growth can only be accelerate by adversity… but you have done no harm.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Perhaps there is another way we might hasten her enlightenment?
"What do you propose?"

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Madilon believes the Dryads come from across Aeternum to protect and care for nature here. I suspect otherwise.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Collect fresh Dryad samples and water from the Azoth springs in Glimmerfen. Then we will know more.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: The fresh Dryad samples and Azoth water will give us greater insights. Trust the process, young one.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: Thank you, child. Some might shy away from the Dryads when they seethe as they do. You are brave.

string.comment: female referring to female ("Langlais" = Herbalist Langlais)
string.speaker: Marsh Walker Afolabi
string.name: MarshWalkerAfolabi

resources.string: And indeed these samples prove that the Dryads in Glimmerfen come from all over the island.
Provide Marsh Walker Afolabi with her requested fresh Dryad Cuttings from the Glimmerfen, and Azoth Water from Azoth Springs.
Travel to {POITags} and gather the items for Marsh Walker Afolabi
Collect {itemName}s from the Dryads of the {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from Azoth Springs throughout Reekwater
New Growth
The question that remains to be answered is the Dryads' motivation for coming to Reekwater.
Is it that they come to serve and protect the nature here, or another reason?
"Are you going to tell me?"
I am, but first, I ask your assistance in addressing a concern of my own.
While Madilon has walked these waters for decades, I have done so for centuries, but I have never seen pure Azoth crystals here... until now.
"Where did you see them?"
I saw them in the Virid Grotto, but the fury of the Dryads in the area was fierce - I could not reach them.
If you can collect these crystals from the grotto, I will grant you both knowledge and a rare gift.
The Dryads in the grotto are enraged to a degree unlike any time I've seen in the past. Do take care collecting the crystals.
Your return warms my blood, young one. Let me see these crystals.
Azoth indeed, and most peculiar to be growing there. I will have to study them, but I think I promised you something in return… what was it?
"Knowledge and a gift, I believe."
Of course. You'll also remember the question of why Dryads come to Reekwater.
I will tell you this much - it is 'for the water' that they come. The rest, you'll learn in time. Oh, and here's your gift.
I have told you all I can for now, young one. Speak to Herbalist Langlais, and I feel certain you will learn more together.
Search the Virid Grotto for Azoth crystals, and bring pieces of them back for Marsh Walker Afolabi in the Reekwater Settlement.
Seek out the Azoth Crystals within the {POITags}
Collect samples of {itemName}s
Excising the Blighted Root
Ah, it's you. I am pleased you have returned. I have studied my journals and reminded myself of all things relevant to restoring harmony here.
"Where do we start?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: The greatest factor in the destabilization of nature now is of course the Blight.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: I suspect you have seen it elsewhere, but the threat is greater here, because the gathering of Dryads could cause it to spread.. well, everywhere.
"So it must be purged quickly?"

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Exactly. The infected Dryads must be destroyed, particularly one large one in Lambent Muskeg.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Destroy it and retrieve any Blight nodules. Then please also make sure it hasn't spread to Fisher's Glory.
Blight cannot be allowed to take hold here in Reekwater. The stakes are too high.
Good to see you back in one piece. Let us hope that your actions today helped curb the Blight. It is a great relief to learn it hasn't spread to Fisher's Glory.

Hunt down The Blight Bringer and any Blight Nodules in Lambent Muskeg, then travel to Fisher's Glory to ensure the Blight has not spread. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and stop the spread of the Blight
Find and eliminate the {targetName}
Destroy the Blight Nodules
Defeat the {targetName} Dryads to ensure the Blight has not spread
Burden of Atonement
Of course, necessary as it may have been, killing the Dryads in Fisher's Glory will be an offense to the Angry Earth.
If we mean to restore harmony, we will have to atone for that.
"How do we atone?"
It is not difficult. Place this offering on the altar at the foot of Fisher's Glory, so they all can see it.
Just... be on guard. One of the large dryads might come to forcibly extract your amends.
I appreciate you humoring me with this penance. Marsh Walker Afolabi would say we're wasting our time, but time will tell.
Ah, I can sense some measure of serenity returning to the marshes. You have done the right thing, regardless of what anyone else says.
Take the Dryad Offering to the Mysterious Altar in Fisher's Glory as an apology. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.
Travel to {POITags} and make an offering at the Dryad's altar
Seek out the Dryad's altar
(Optional) Place the Dryad Offering on the Mysterious Altar
Complete the Dryad's Trial of Penance
Upstream Investigation
Now, I hope you'll help me resolve one other point of contention with Afolabi.
She insists the Dryads gathering here from across Aeternum is not to protect Reekwater.
"She says it's 'for the water'."
For the water, you say? She really believes it's to bathe themselves in the Azoth-infused waters here?
I simply cannot imagine their motive to be so self-centered, so... self-indulgent.
"Perhaps there's more to it."
Not to the Marsh Walker's mind, I suspect. But let's try to prove her wrong.
The Ancients knew such matters. Would you indulge me and search some of the older ruins for clues to why the Dryads gather here?
I'm convinced that the Ancient ruins will give us insights. If you don't find anything at first, just… keep trying.
Search Sha Makogai and the fallen lighthouse, Hingatirn, for any clues on the Dryads' presence in Reekwater. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.
So you found something then? Let's see... oh dear, this is quite dreadful!
The Ancients dissected the Dryads for some nefarious purpose... I wonder if that's related to them coming here. Perhaps some cycle of vengeance?
"What about this sketch?"
This isn't of Ancient design... this is something else. Much simpler. Perhaps a child's drawing?
And what is this body of water? It appears to be a sacred place to the Dryads.
Explore {POITags} for any clues to the Dryads' presence
Search the lower ruins for clues to the Dryads' presence
Collect Clues about the Dryads
Investigate the fallen tower of Hingatirn
Search for further clues connecting the Dryads to the Ancients
The Eternal Pool (Elite)
Ah, yes… of course! There are legends about a place called the Eternal Pool. With this drawing, we may finally have discovered the pool's location.
"We should go there."
Absolutely. It appears to be on the northern plateau, and that is indeed a place the Dryads protect quite fiercely.
I'm sure it's where we'll learn the truth about them. Go if you dare, but I suggest you don't go alone.
There could be anything waiting for you up on the plateau. Best gather some friends and watch yourself.
Investigate the Eternal Pool and face whatever challenges lie within. Then report to Herbalist Langlais in the Reekwater Settlement.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: You... returned. I can't even imagine what you must've witnessed there. The pool is pure Azoth, isn't it?

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Yes, I've spent more time studying the sketches you recovered. The pool is the reason the Dryads come to Reekwater.
"It's where they go to die."

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: Yes, just as Afolabi hinted, they give their life energy to the water, returning the Azoth back to Aeternum. It's inspiring.

string.comment: female referring to female (Marsh Walker Afolabi)
string.speaker: Herbalist Langlais
string.name: HerbalistLanglais

resources.string: I have learned more today about the Angry Earth, about nature, and most of all, that I have more to learn.
Thank you, {playerName}, for helping me finally learn the truth about the Dryads… and myself.
Travel to the {POITags}
Breach the Dryad Veils
Collect Ancient relics from containers
Collect {itemName} from the Pride of the Trees
Defeat the {targetName}
The Dryad Promenade (Elite)
Greetings again, young one. You have been to the Eternal Pool and seen the truth.
Reekwater is the end of the cycle of life for the Dryads, but balance is still not restored.
"What's still out of balance?"
The Protector of the Source exceeds his mandate - the pool belongs to all life forms.
Like other Dryads, he too must return his essence to the waters. Do what must be done, young one.
To defeat the Protector of the Source, I would suggest you bring allies.
[BLANK]
Follow the Dryad Promenade path into the depths of the Eternal Pool, and lay the Protector of the Source to rest.
Travel to the {POITags}
(Optional) Acquire a {itemName}
Defeat the {targetName}
Reekwater is the end of the cycle of life for the Dryads, but balance is still not restored.
Grasping at Shadows
Good to see you again, {playerName}! I hope Fulvius didn't hassle you too much for not bringing back that artifact. Thank you for keeping the secret.
As thanks, I have something you may be interested in.
"Oh? What's that?"
A weapon which channels the power of... I'm not entirely certain, actually. The one I have is broken.
It looks akin to those other gauntlets I've seen, the ones that channel the darker energies of the island, though we won't know for sure until it is fixed.
"So you need my help to fix it?"
Spot on! From those other gauntlets, I was able to pull together a list of what should be needed to fix it.
One of the few powerful items from the past constructed by our hands, not the Ancients! So, help me fix it, and the gauntlet is yours.
I'll wait here for your return, don't worry.
Gather the components needed to reconstruct Umbra's Reach.
Complete Quest: In Brightest Light
Complete Quest: Stygian Channel
Complete Quest: Grasping Twilight
Complete Quest: A Stitch of Shade
Complete Quest: In Darkest Shadow
Complete Quest: Power of the Void
Complete Quest: Dusky Focus
Complete Quest: Hold Back the Night
A pleasure to see you, as always! Now, how goes the progress on our little shopping list? Have you found everything I needed?
"Yes, I have it all."
Perfect! Here, let me... yes, these will do nicely. I've prepared what I could while you were out, so these repairs shouldn't take long at all.
"Take your time."
... tighten this like so, and... there! Finished! A shame... this should be in a museum as well, but with all that's going on, it would just go to waste there.
There were notes found nearby, but everything was in Gaelic! Likely a name in there as well, but I think I'll call it "Umbra's Reach". Catchy, isn't it?
Ah, Umbra's Reach. On anyone else's hand, it would actually give me cause for concern, but not so with you. Wear it well, and in good faith, friend.
In Brightest Light
Gather Pure Azoth Water from Azoth Springs to recharge the Azoth Energy Source.
Travel to {POITags} to locate the Azoth Energy Source
Find the Azoth Energy Source in Syleio Seko
Locate sources of Azoth Water to recharge the Energy Source
Stygian Channel
Travel to Mourningdale and recover the Stygian Channel Segments.
Search for the Stygian Channel Segments in:
{POITags}
Collect Stygian Channel Segments
Grasping Twilight
In Shattered Mountain, gather Filaments from the armor of Ancient Guardians, then use them to reinforce a Layered Leather Glove.
Venture into the depths of {POITags} to search for the Guardian Armor Filaments
Claim {itemName}s from the {targetName} Guardians
Find, craft, or purchase {itemName}
Use an Outfitting Station to craft a set of Reinforced Leather Gloves
A Stitch of Shade
Collect fibers from Wyrdwood Seed Pods scattered throughout Edengrove.
Search for Wyrdwood Seed Pods near Wyrdwood Trees in:
{POITags}
Collect Wyrdwood Seed Fibers
In Darkest Shadow
Gather Void Crystal Fragments from Blightcrag deposits throughout Aeternum.
Gather Void Crystal Fragments from Blightcrag deposits throughout Aeternum
Power of the Void
Empower the Void Crystal Fragments by assaulting Corruption Breaches throughout Aeternum
Defeat the Corrupted within Corruption Breaches to empower the Void Crystal Fragments
Dusky Focus
Gather Shards of Purest Crystal from the Dynasty soldiers in Ebonscale Reach, then craft a Pure Crystal Lens.
Travel to the {POITags} to seek out Shards of Purest Crystal
Claim {itemName} from the Corrupted Palace soldiers
Use the collected Shards to craft a Pure Crystal Lens at a Workshop
Hold Back the Night
Collect Protective Resin from the most ancient Angry Earth in Reekwater, then create Resin-Hardened Leather.
Seek out the most ancient Angry Earth in {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from the {targetName} Dryads
Find, craft, or purchase {itemName}
Use a Tannery to craft Resin-Hardened Leather
The Original Guardian (Expedition)
Collect the Guardian's Eye from Chardis in the Lazarus Well Expedition. Then report to Legatus Fulvius in the Reekwater Settlement.
There may be one thing, however, that could redeem this entire initiative.
Among the tablets you gathered, I've seen reference to a place known as the Lazarus Well.
"What's the Lazarus Well?"
I'm not entirely sure, but some of the glyphs show images of a massive, many-eyed Ancient Guardian.
Something like this has never been seen, of course, so one would assume it is very dangerous.
"I can handle the danger."
Very well. You certainly seem capable enough to me, but you might want to bring allies.
Defeat this… Original Guardian Chardis in the Lazarus Well and bring me his eye. You will be well-rewarded.
If you can get me the eye of that Original Guardian, this journey won't have been a waste after all.
You survived the Lazarus Well? After you left, I deciphered clues suggesting it was even more dangerous than I knew.
But you did it! And more importantly, the Eye! Yes, this... is quite a prize!
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Guardian Chardis for {itemName}
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Guardian Chardis for {itemName}
The druid Eoin Dornoll seeks help in retrieving 3 ancient hearts of enemies within Lazarus Instrumentality so that he can study how the Ancients corrupted the natrual order and created immortality.
Death's Demise
Flee this place while you still can, stranger. It's an insult to the natural order.
Turn back, stranger. You are about to set foot in the most unholy place in all our strange land. Leave and preserve what remains of your soul.
"I don’t shrink from danger."
It is said this is where the Ancients committed their most egregious crimes against the natural order. This is where they broke the cycles of life and death.
"They created immortals here?"
Exactly. The Ancients harnessed the energy of this place… they transformed the ignorant humans who worshipped them into eternal soldiers…
This blasphemy set the stage for the endless misery that plagues us all on Aeternum, robbing us of a peaceful hereafter… imprisoning us on this violent island for all of eternity.
“Eternal life can be a burden.”
And for their sake, we must expose the accursed evils committed here. Bring me hearts from the Guardians, and I'll study them for clues to whatever heinous magic the Ancients employed.
For the sake of all those eternally suffering on Aeternum, I need those hearts.
Yes, I believe these hearts are exactly what I needed… they stink of the foul magics the Ancients used for their... historic atrocity.
At long last, there is hope that I will find true rest... so long overdue. When I am done with these, all on Aeternum who wish, can finally find their way to oblivion…
Collect Ancient Heart from Damysys
Collect Ancient Heart from Cilla
Collect Ancient Heart from Chardis
The earth hums in gratitude for your services. I am studying the hearts you have retrieved but their lifeblood is finite. Come back later and I'll have another task for you.
Strangers. If you have come to serve you must cleanse yourself with imbued Azoth Water. Go now, to the bath chamber and return once you are done.
You've returned, but not all of you are cleansed. Return to me when all of you have completed this task.
You've returned, but not all of you are present. Return to me with all of the members of your group.
You've returned. I see you are cleansed. I still question your worth. Are you willing to risk all to prove your value?
xx
Greetings, fellow Grand Master. What news do you bring?
You must be one with the fish, one with the waters… If you wish to be a Grand Master Fisher like me.
You must be one with the fish, one with the waters… If you wish to be a Grand Master Fisher like me.
